meanings.definition: To report less than the actual amount or number.
meanings.sent1: She tends to underreport her expenses when filling out the forms.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to underreport your income on your tax return.
meanings.sent3: The detective realized the suspect was trying to underreport the stolen items to avoid suspicion.
meanings.sent4: The student decided to underreport the number of hours spent studying, hoping to impress the teacher with natural talent.
meanings.sent5: Underreporting the damages caused by the storm could lead to delays in receiving aid.

meanings.definition: To provide insufficient or inaccurate information in a report.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to underreport the environmental impact of their operations.
meanings.sent2: It is unethical to underreport the side effects of a medication in a research paper.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would underreport the number of times he tripped on stage to save face.
meanings.sent4: The journalist warned that underreporting the facts could damage the credibility of the news outlet.
meanings.sent5: The student was caught trying to underreport the results of the experiment to avoid criticism.
